intro: Diglyphosa, commonly known as the two-leaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its aromatic foliage and medicinal properties have made it of interest in traditional herbal medicine. However, it is important to note that the genus is relatively rare and not widely cultivated.
